resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.

fields.summary: SCALE TESTING: CC memory leak when instance cache fills

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: SCALE TESTING: CC's state is flaky with large number of instances

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When testing 2,000 monitoring enabled instances in a cluster, sensor information is periodically not returned to the cloud controller. 

No errors were seen in cluster controller log files (cc.log, httpd-cc_error_log) during the test.

The sensor data was monitored using:

{code}
euca-modify-property -peuca='com.eucalyptus.cluster.callback.reporting.AbsoluteMetricQueue.dataQueue.size()'
{code}

to periodically check if the queue had any items (describing sensors is performed every 5 mins by default)

List metrics showed no results after initially running the instances for ~20 minutes and then some instances were present. After a while no sensor data was returned in requests, which continued for 15-20 minutes (etc)
fields.summary: EC2 describe sensors response sometimes missing data when running 2,000 instances

[~sjones], how many AZ did you have in this set up?

[~sjones],
I set up a system with 108 monitored instances. So far it seems to be working fine and reports all data points:
{code}
PROPERTY	euca	0 was executed successfully.
PROPERTY	euca	760 was executed successfully.
PROPERTY	euca	1520 was executed successfully.
PROPERTY	euca	2280 was executed successfully.

PROPERTY	euca	0 was executed successfully.
{code}
I will have it running for some time. If it will work as expected I'd need to get access to a bigger set up. [~viglesias]
System does have all data-point after 4 hours of monitoring with 108 instances. I'd need more servers to test this. Will create a mini-scale system.

With 208 monitored instances queue still has right numbers
{code}

{code}
[~viglesias] I need a BIG set up to chase this issue.
With over 2000 instance I see that censors data is not reported regularly.

[~tony], this issue was manifesting itself only if CC was running more than 2048 instances. So in theory you need to have a BIG set up to test this bug. It was possible to run more instances then one CC can story in the memory (2048). The limit now is enforced, so strictly speaking you should not be able to create a condition that triggers this issue.
[~vasya], oh OK. I was using the scale system and was monitoring while running scale test that created 2000 instances.
